lines.text: Science? Nonsense! In this situation mediocrity and genius are equally useless! I must tell you that we really have no desire to conquer any cosmos. We want to extend the Earth up to its borders. We don't know what to do with other worlds. We don't need other worlds. We need a mirror. We struggle to make contact, but we'll never achieve it. We are in a ridiculous predicament of man pursuing a goal that he fears and that he really does not need. Man needs man!
You mean more to me than any scientific truth.

We don't want to conquer space at all. We want to expand Earth endlessly. We don't want other worlds; we want a mirror. We seek contact and will never achieve it. We are in the foolish position of a man striving for a goal he fears and doesn't want. Man needs man!
You love that which you can lose, yourself, a woman, a country.
Man was created by Nature in order to explore it. As he approaches Truth he is fated to Knowledge. All the rest is bullshit.
Did you ever think of me?
Only when I was sad.
Whenever we show pity, we empty our souls.
Guibariane did not die of fear, he died out of shame. The salvation of humanity is in its shame!

Well, anyway, my mission is finished. And what next? To return to Earth? Little by little everything will return to normal. I'll find new interests, new acquaintances, but I won't be able to devote all of myself to them.
I have a feeling someone's deceiving us.
There are so few of us!
Remember Tolstoy? His suffering over the impossibility of loving mankind as a whole? How much time has passed since then? Somehow I can't figure it out. Help me.
You're human. Each in your own way. That's why you argue.
This house reminds me of my grandfather's house. I really liked it so we decided to bujild one just like it. I don't like innovation.
Didn't you say research should continue at any price?
You want to destroy that which we are presently incapable of understanding? Forgive me but am not advocate of knowledge at any price.
Knowledge is only valid when it's based on morality.
Man is the one who renders science moral or immoral. Remember Hiroshima?
Then don't make science immoral.
If you see something out of the ordinary, something besides me and Sartorius try not to lose your head.
What would I see?
I don't know, that sort of depends on you.
Your position is absurd. Your so-called courage is inhuman.
Don't worry, I won't think you're insane.
Insane? God, you know absolutely nothing. Insane... that would be a blessing.
Who's this? Kris it's me!
I am my own judge.
Sometimes you become a clown without wanting to.
Don't tell me you haven't tried a rope or a hammer. Did you happen to throw the inkwell like Luther? No?
Who was it? She died 10 years ago.
What you saw was the materialization of your conception of her.
Incidentally, consider yourself lucky. After all she's part of your past. What if it had been something you had never seen before, but something you had thought or imagined.
When you turn into an utter cripple with no arms or legs, call us. We'll empty your chamber pot.
Listen... I don't know myself. I don't remember. When I close my eyes, I can't recall my face. And you?
What?
Do you know yourself?
That woman in the white coat, she hated me.
Don't make things up. She died before you and I met.
She's sleeping. Will she follow me?
Don't lock the door.
What door? It's just an apparition
Get some sleep.
I don't know how to sleep. It's not sleep, it's somehow around me. It's as if it wasn't just inside me, but much farther away.
Mankind has lost the ability to sleep.

When I sleep, I know no fear, no hope, no trouble, no bliss, Blessing on him he who invented sleep. The common coin that purchases all things, the balance that levels the shepherd and king, fool and wise. There is only one bad thing about sleep. They say it closely resembles death.
In his endless search for truth, man is condemned to knowledge. Everything else is a whim.
It doesn't matter why man loves. It's different for everyone.
Don't turn a scientific problem into a common love story.
What does it matter when you're worth more to me than any science could ever be?

Suffering makes life seem dismal and suspicious. But I wont accept that, no I wont accept that. Is that which is indispensable to life also harmful to it? No, It's not harmful. Of course it's not harmful.
Yourself, a woman, a homeland. Until today, love was simply unattainable to mankind, to the earth. Maybe we are here to experience people as a reason for love.
Shame, the feeling that will save mankind.
You know, It's really embarrassing but for some reason... I've completely forgotten your face
When man is happy, the meaning of life and other eternal themes rarely interest him. These questions should be asked at the end of one's life.
But we don't know when life will end. That's why we're in such a hurry.
To ask is always the desire to know. Yet the preservation of simple human truths requires mystery. The mysteries of happiness, death, and love. To think about it is to know one's day of death.
Maybe you're right, but try not to think about all that now.
Not knowing that day makes us practically immortal.
